attributes.action: Stop the erosion on citizens' rights!
attributes.additional_details:
It is very frightening to live in a country where we need to write to a government to ask them to consider these basic rights. Anyone would mistake this as a petition to a dictatorship, let alone a government. 

If the current government had any of these in their manifesto, they would not have been voted in.
attributes.background:
1) Do not make digital ID as mandatory
2) Do not take away the right to a jury
3) Ensure food security by funding farmers properly
4) Stop policing social media so harshly by criminalising opinions and concentrate on actual hate crimes
5) Remove the laws which prohibit protests

rejection.details:
There are already open petitions on these issues such as: 

Do not introduce Digital ID cards 
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/730194

Do not remove trial by jury for certain cases 
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/751480

Align to Intl. Law to Protect Farming as Cultural Heritage & Nat’l Security Asset 
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/739672

Repeal the Public Order Act 2023 & Police, Crime, Sentencing and Courts Act 2022 
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/734380

You could start a new petition centred on the issue you raise related to social media.
